com.eemi.ext4j.client.layout

Class HBoxLayout

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.eemi.ext4j.client.layout.ContainerLayout
      • com.eemi.ext4j.client.layout.BoxLayout
        • com.eemi.ext4j.client.layout.HBoxLayout

  • public class HBoxLayout
extends BoxLayout
    A layout that arranges items vertically down a Container. This layout optionally divides available vertical space between child items containing a numeric flex configuration. The flex option is a ratio that distributes height after any items with explicit heights have been accounted for. In the code below, the height is calculated as follows: The fixed height item is subtracted, leaving us with 300 height The total flex number is counted, in this case, it is 3 The ratio is then calculated, 300 / 3 = 100 The first item has a flex of 2, so it is set to 2 * 100 The other remaining item is set to 1 * 100
